name.namePart: Printed in Paris by Edmond Desjobert

mods.abstract: The women is a representation of Judith from the Old Testament. It is a facial study of a female figure who represents the Biblical character of Judith.
mods.note: The lithograph is part of the artist's Old Testament Women Series. The print uses four colors -- a chartreuse, dark grey, pink flesh tones, and light grey. The initial drawing was made using dry brushes and washes. The print, as well as the series, reflects an interest held by the artist in female figures from the Bible.

name.namePart: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.). Museum of Art

titleInfo.title: Caroline Wogan Durieux Works of Art
